title: Very easy to use
text: I have a rare genetic disorder that causes severe joint damage.  My grip isn't what it used to be. I must admit that I am a bit of a butterfingers.  Shakey hands and an expensive cellphone are not a good combination.  This has helped me feel more secure.  I can stick my finger in the loop and I don't have to worry about accidentally dropping it.  It's a basic black so it blends in with my phone.  It feels comfortable in my hand so I barely even notice it.

title: Perfect for my old eyes
text: I like to buy crochet patterns off the internet,  but I am getting  older and it's hard to see them on my little phone.  This is the perfect solution because it magnifies everything and it holds my phone up as well.  I can set it up on my table and reference it whenever I start a new row.  It doesn't distort the picture at all and my phone feels secure in it.

title: Very easy to use
text: [[VIDEOID:d7ccc8ad8d82613076a27034079e6501]] I have a rare genetic disorder that causes severe joint damage and as a result,  I have been a wheelchair user for many years.  I like to decorate my wheelchair with lights and projectors so I usually end up powering them with powerbanks.  I have used a lot of powerbanks and they all work the same for the most part.  However,  this one is a little different.  It contains some charging cords already attached to the bank.  It has a charging cable for a micro USB, a type c one, and one of those Apple ones.  Now anyone can use it to charge their phone in an emergency regardless of the type.  It is also less bulky and easier to use on my lights.  Now I don't have to worry about a separate cable dangling down or getting snagged on something.  It takes up less room as well because the cords wrap around the bank and get tucked into the sides.  The battery life is great and the charging time isn't bad either.

title: A perfect fit
text: I bought this for my new phone.  I didn't like my original case so I decided to go with something different.  The best part is that it has a secret compartment for my debit card and driver's license.  This looks like a regular phone case so it's very discrete and no one suspects a thing.  It also has a built-in phone stand.

title: Doesn't work at all
text: This doesn't work at all and the tech support is non existent.  The no contract thing isn't accurate.  They will charge you over and over again

title: Adorable!
text: I have a rare genetic disorder that causes severe joint damage.  My grip is getting worse so I was having issues holding my phone.  I was a little concerned that this wouldn't hold up well,  but it's been a few weeks and it still works great.  I can stick the ring part on my hand so when my grip fails I don't drop it.  I also like using it to prop up my phone.  Now I can have it by my side on the counter as I cook.

title: It does the job
text: This isn't anything to write home about,  but it does the job.  It's sturdy enough to feel like it's mostly protected.  I do wish that it had some sort of screen protector.

title: It makes a huge difference in my picture quality
text: I bought this for my new phone.  I must admit that I wasn't expecting it to do much.  I was pleasantly surprised by how big of a difference it makes.  It's good for taking traditional pictures,  but it's great for selfies.  The extra light makes me look ten years younger.  It clips onto my phone so I can just leave it there until I need it if I want to.  It's a set of two so you can share one with a friend or have a backup to use while the other is charging.  The battery life is great and it doesn't take too long to fully charge.

title: Strong hold
text: [[VIDEOID:5e3fcd8f50aef01be8e419baa58527fc]] I have a love/hate relationship with phone holders.  They can be convenient,  but if they aren't secure then they can be dangerous.  The last thing you want is for your phone to fly into your face during an accident or even just a sudden stop.  This one is much different.  It holds the phone securely,  but it also attaches to the car vent very well.  I don't have to worry about it being knocked out of place or my phone getting damaged.  There's also a really nice feature that I have never seen before.  You can actually move the phone itself out of the way of the vent.  I live in a very warm place so I really appreciate that it isn't blocking my air conditioning.

title: Fast charging
text: [[VIDEOID:48c6fde951c5a882fe563892dee55660]] I bought this for my new van.  I wanted something that would hold my phone securely while I use it hands free.  I was excited to see that it also charges my phone.  I don't need to plug it in or anything.  It charges wirelessly through the stand.  It holds securely to the vent so I don't have to worry about it falling or damaging anything.

title: Perfect for newbies
text: I bought this for my sister who recently started doing gardening videos.  She needed something to hold her phone in place while she filmed,  but this is so much more.  It has a supplemental light for the top.  Since she's outdoors I thought she wouldn't need this, but it has really made a difference.  It also comes with attachments that act as red or blue filters.  These are especially handy for taking pictures of her flowers.  It includes a microphone that clips directly on the tripod.  Again,  I thought this wasn't necessary,  but the difference is incredible.  Even outside,  it picks up her voice much better. It has a cover so it's not effected by the wind.  There's a remote shutter as well.  It's really helpful for starting and stopping the videos

title: Very comfortable
text: [[VIDEOID:2b654e7327c64dca3c90faefe0cdb17a]] I bought this set for my son's smart watch.  He's like any kid -- rough and tumble.  When he broke the original strap, I knew he needed something more durable.  These are a much better option.  They are stretchy and they are adjustable so you can get the right fit for your wrist.  The set includes 5 different colors and they are easy to change so you can switch them out to match your outfit.

title: Easy to use
text: I bought this for my husband to use at work.  It has space for his watch, phone and airpods.  It also doubles as a phone stand.  Now he can watch videos while it charges.  The whole device is rather small so it doesn't take up a lot of space on his desk.

title: Very easy to install
text: I bought this for my son's new phone.  He's kind of rough on his phone so he needed something stronger than the flimsy one it came with.  This is a much better option.  It's very sturdy and looks great on his phone.  It was very easy to install and it even comes with a spare.

title: Enough space for all of my devices
text: [[VIDEOID:61be9b3310bf7e8f5b6bb0c543d2817c]] I bought this for my nightstand.  I like to charge all of my devices at night, but I'm limited on space.  This is the perfect solution.  It saves a lot of space because I can stack my tablets and phones upright instead of lying them flat.  There are separate cords to plug in the devices that can't be charged wirelessly, but I only need one available outlet to plug it into.  I was a little concerned that it would be really slow since there are so many pieces plugged into it.  Fortunately,  it seems to charge just as quickly as a regular charger.

title: Much nicer than other powerbanks
text: [[VIDEOID:f9e6c94c70f0c812cf9795d4217c2b68]] I have used several different brands of powerbanks before and they all basically work the same way.  It charges my phone quickly and it doesn't take long to recharge the powerbank.  It does have some interesting features that I haven't seen before.  There's a digital display of how much power is left.  This is a lot more convenient than than the typical 4 bars that approximate how much power has been used.  It's a square instead of a rectangle.  Now when I am digging around in my bag, I immediately know the difference between it and my phone plus it takes up less space.  It also comes with a wrist strap.  This is really handy because I can actually use my phone while it's charging.  The powerbank just hangs there out of the way, but still close enough to prevent the cord from being pulled out.  This probably doesn't matter to some,  but I really like how cute it is.  The marble design with gold accents is simply gorgeous!

title: A real space saver
text: I bought this for my husband who has far too many devices.  Our nightstand was cluttered with various chargers for his phone, watch, and airpods.  Thankfully,  this charges them all at once.  It takes up less space than one of his other chargers and it charges just as quickly.  It also doubles as a stand for his phone while reading in bed.

title: Very handy
text: I bought this for my husband who is always misplacing his phone.  This is a great option because it clips right onto his belt or waistband.  His phone is rather large, but it still fits well.  There's also a second pocket for cigs or a money clip.  There's also a place to clip his keys onto.

title: Fort Knox protection at a bargain price
text: [[VIDEOID:18482816c5457ee2f3f485f40c70bb67]] I must admit that I am kind of rough on my phone.  I drop it quite a bit and I worry about it getting scratched in my bag. title: Easy to use
text: I must admit that I am a bit of a butterfingers.  Shakey hands and an expensive cellphone are not a good combination.  This has helped me feel more secure. title: Great little dry bag.
text:
[[VIDEOID:65a7557fca9e51aafc523c58efd3890c]] Very easy to use, nice size also. Triple seal and velcro to secure. Easy to adjust the belt to correct size needed and fits wide range of sizes. Holds multiple items and is great to use while at the beach or if you are boating. I live in Central Florida and rain is a normal almost daily thing through the summer this is a must have. We mainly have this on hand for cell phones in case we are out and it rains. I walk a lot and this is great to use for that while being hands free to push a stroller. Cell phone and ID some cash or debit cards all can fit in here with ease. Just nothing sharp!
I did my water test with my camera as it is waterproof just in case. I let it stay in the sink of water for about 5 minutes, it kept floating so I would turn and dunk and swish it. It stayed dry!!!! I recommend that before each use you look it over in the light for any holes or possible rips and check the seams also. You may be careful with it but it can weaken with sun and heat exposure. I received this product free sin exchange for testing and review purposes. I am satisfied with the product as it did what it was supposed to do.

title: High quality.
text: High quality Type C charging cable. I have two sets of these and there are excellent. The long length lets me plug into the wall behind my head board and reach my dresser. I also  needed the long cord for behind my desk. Thick braided and sturdy. I also have used these daily and they connect very well into my phone port. ( Nexus 5x and 6p). The connection is solid and charging is smooth. There is no power gap in them. I also love that they are black and white so they look different than the iPad and Samsung cords so finding it is fast and easy. These were provided to me for free for consumer testing and review. Totally happy. ( I have other iKits products and they are excellent quality, have been very satisfied with this brand)

title: In home docking.
text:
Pretty neat! I use this as an in home dock, not in the car. ( I have a car holder already). Simple to use and to adjust. I took off one star because it is almost to easy to adjust and the holder piece pulls from the flat pad fairly easy. While it doesn't affect the in home use it may affect the car use and it may fall out with a hard turn and the weight of a phone.
It works easily for a tablet also. We can put a Samsung 7" and when you widen out the holder we can place an iPad mini in it also. Great to use at the bedside and takes very little room. The rubber is thick and a good quality it isn't going to split or tear. What is really great is this seals so well to almost any surface and doesn't slide around. There is also nothing to break!! Fits such a wide range of phones and tablets.
I was provided this dash mat for consumer use and review.

title: Nice, daily case.
text: Overall this is a good case. The color was true to the description. I took off a star because in person the color is best suited to a white phone. Two piece design, rubber and hard shell that snaps on to provide grip and extra protection. The ports and buttons are lined up perfect and it fits true to the phone. Super fast to get on and off but stays on well. The outer shell snaps on with ease holding the rubber piece snug to the phone. This case does not come with a screen protector you will need to supply that separate. Also, this is a good case for daily use , this is not a rugged case but should offer some protection against small drops. I received this case for review free of charge.

title: I ordered wrong, item good.
text: Product is fine, seems to be of good quality.I unfortunately ordered the wrong one. My husband has a different Garmin. My fault and not the product. We can't use them. They did arrive on time and were as described. Also packaged well and came with all that was needed to apply them ( like a cell phone one). I received this product free in order to test/use/review.

title: Cardboard is good but need to upgrade
text:
First, it is a good product for what it is, it is a cardboard, fold up VR viewer. So while I want to give it 4 stars I have to hold back due to a couple things.

The good: Affordable, easy to fold, easy to use
This is a great way to get your toes wet in VR without pricey commitment. Also this is very low tech and easy to use for many people.
The bad: Cardboard, parts will tear somewhat easy ( fixed temporarily with tape)
Doesn't fit too many styles of phones. Able to fit a Nexus 5X but the 6P is too large ( and cases need to come off)
The rubber band that you are supposed to use to hold it on has no stretch so we can't use it....makes it totally hand held and arms tired.
The verdict: If you want an introduction to VR that wont break the bank this is okay. If you want to try it and see if it makes you "sick" then this is a good choice. There is an app available "cardboard" and you can get the info by scanning a QR code on the viewer. There are neat scenes to download and enjoy. We know now that we would like to up the game and try a hard plastic model . Now, I know some of you hate the "I received" reviews but I did get this discounted. I STILL PURCHASED THIS ITEM ( just a discount given )and I am satisfied with it for what it is. Current price is $10 and that is okay. No, it is not worth more and I would not pay more for the cardboard models. Yes, it is good for an intro and to see if you think you would even use it.

title: Sanity saver...get organized !!
text:
*still using this hub and it still works great!*Excellent, excellent, and excellent!!! Our computer desk stays a wreck with cords and the electronics attached to them. We have three tablets and a soon to be 4th and they will all rest in this stand perfect ( iPad mini, two nexus, and soon a kids fire tab) we also have two different styles Nexus phones and a windows, and a Samsung, they also fit with ease. All my electronics brought together and located in one place, no more where is my cord, where is my tablet, have you seen....If you are looking for one it is certainly worth the full retail. Get organized !

text:
We purchase new phones often, keeping up with new tech. We also always choose otter box for protection. Well, I love the way it looked on the phone but it did not properly snap together. There were gaps on both sides (front) and the actual clasp never would "snap". Perhaps defective or maybe just the design itself. I had to send it back, it would not stay on. Even just gripping it could cause it to unbuckle. I sent it back and got a defender.

For some reason the defender series for this phone are actually fairly thin. If you have prime and get the free ship and return then you may want to try it and see how it goes if you like the case, otherwise stick to commuter or defender.

The case is clear by the way, so if you have a white phone it will appear like the picture.

title: I ended up with Black

title: I don't understand the need to lie - 72 watts.
text: First it does work, and it was fast, on my phone. But this depends on a lot of factors. The charging technology in your phone, and the starting charge level of your battery, all impacts how the process proceeds, and the resulting VA output. 72 watts is a semantical error. This will never happen. The unit itself states if you attempt this mythical 72 watt charge, it will only produce 24 watts max, while using both ports. Since the theoretical max is 36 watts on a single port then the actual max is 36 watts. In practice, you likely will only get 27 watts max, based on what's plugged in for the vast majority of uses. I have not tried plugging in a laptop, yet, but I will. It seems though, 36 watts might be a little light for that use. We will have to see. My main reason for purchasing this, was it's size. I will keep it for that and it's practical charging speed.

title: OMG a fiber under the glass
text: This is as easy and precise as you can get. Regardless, I still have a very fine carpet fiber right in the center of my display. I did all I could. Removing the plastic cover protecting the adhesive, create static. If there are any fibers near by, it will get picked up even while being careful. I am living with it for now. Not wasting glass for that.

title: The guid didn't get the glass aligned as well as I like
text: All is well. However the guid didn't get the glass aligned as well as I like. Given the high precision needed, I though this should be better aligned. Don't get me wrong, if this was an iPhone 6/6s/7/8 (pluses included) It would be great. However I am always reminded of the slight skew at the stop of the screen, overlapping the notch from the right, maybe a 10th mm. Maybe the edges should be a little more tapered, I can feel it a bit. All in all, nicely done.

title: Very grippy, for what it's worth...

title: I was less than pleasantly surprised
text: I am a little disappointed. I thought this was a front and back, but it's two front screen protectors. I am sold on glass, but choose to use Skinomi on the back. I ordered with that intent. It's my fault, but I wish it was a bit more clear... Prior product I have purchased for the iPhone 7 Plus, included all sides. I was less than pleasantly surprised. All in all, I made the best of it.

title: The second time around is not as good as the first
text:
I have used this before, and bought again. I am not sure what I am doing wrong. The second time around is not as good as the first.

1. The first unit I got, was at ROSS of all places. It was 100% perfect, and protected my phone, when I dropped it.

2. The second unit, has the exact same problem as a no-name glass. The upper left hand corner does not want to stick. Maybe there's something on my phone. However this same reaction is happening on two phones, and two separate brands. Maybe it's the same batch of glass, and they all have the same flaw. Anyway, I am not marking it down for this. In addition to the cover, I am also using a life proof case. So it doesn't really matter, I don't see the bubble. Second, it's providing the protection I am looking for. Inexpensive tempered glass.

title: priced at the top end of the spectrum and it's perfect. I had a similar product as XOXO
text:
These, are probably the hot method for screen covers. Imported from China, at little cost, they can be found for a variety of prices, this 2-Pack, with lifetime warranty, is about the bottom price range.

PRO: I ordered mine around midnight, Friday, and received it the following Sunday. Which means, they sent it out on Saturday, and I got it the very next day. So this is incredible, never had Sunday delivery. I felt special. :-) Their HQ is in San Francisco, so that must explain it all, being so close. :-)

CON: As hard as I try, I can't get the screen cover to sit fully on my iPhone 5/5S screens. I have two devices, and on both of them, the upper left hand corner of the protector, does not stick. There's a slight air gap. It's not particularly noticeable, and it does not touch or interfere with the display, but I hardly think this product is going to stay on. It was a long shot and I suspect my family members will complain about it soon enough. I have a similar product, priced at the top end of the spectrum and it's perfect. I had a similar product as XOXO, priced a bit more moderately and it too was very good. No air gaps.

My complaint for XOXO is, their adhesive is not good enough. There's something not right in it's application. On two separate phones, where it does not stick, in the exact same place, means they have a QA problem.

As far as protecting the phone and the functionality of tempered glass, I won't have it any other way. This product will do that job, I am sure, very well. My son's phone has already been saved by the sacrificial nature of tempered glass.

The texture of the cover, touching and moving across the screen, is silky smooth. I like it a lot. It's practically invisible, and does not change the appearance of the screen.

I wish I could give it more stars, but at this point, the adhesive and warrantee seem to be the only factor separating this product from all the others. It's not working so well, that way.

title: A case for a case
text:
Mixed bag of hurt. While using this case, I dropped my iPhone 6 Plus, and smashed the screen. The case survived without a scratch, what good is that, if I have to spend $130 replacing the screen? Well, it's handsome and gives some stiffness to the phone. It has helped with holding the phone with one hand, but not enough to keep it in my hand while doing something important.

Needless to say, I am going to buy another more rugged case, and this one, will go to a friend. I like it, but it's not enough for me.

4 stars for style, subtracting one star because it's still a bit slippery in the hand. Also, poor communication from the manufacturer, who didn't reply to two of my emails.

The edges of the case are far enough away from the screen that they don't block any of it, but are high enough to protect it when placed face down. Over all, I feel this case is comfortable, well-made, and protects my phone.

However, it's not exactly the look I was expecting. Instead of being clear with an all-over iridescent shine, it's hazy purple with thin bright rainbow lines when light hits it from an angle. There's one awkward spot in the center of the back where it clings closer to the phone and creates a dark patch. I've taken it off multiple times and wiped both pieces to make sure it's not wet, but nothing gets rid of that clingy patch.

I would definitely buy this brand again because of the fit and quality, but I wouldn't get this particular case due to the look.

title: Fits and protects
text:
It fits well, looks good. Seems to be made pretty well. My main problem is that it doesn't communicate with the phone as others I have owned do. Others that I have owned locked the screen when you closed the cover and woke the phone when it opened. This does neither.
I have not owned it long, so I can't speak to it's durability.

title: Good for the $$
text: I love it. My only complaint is that I wish the screen cover were more scratch resistant.
Love it!

title: Attractive; appears sturdy
text: It's what I wanted.

title: It charges tablets and phones well while camping.
text: Packs easily even in a backpack.  Is sturdy and charges well.

title: Protects my phone with easy access to the exterior buttons
text: I love how sturdy this is and the color was as represented.

title: very nice for the price
text: Pretty simple phone case. Flexible and fits easily around your phone.

title: not bad for $5
text: Not bad for 5$. seems to be pretty sturdy. Very pretty color. Easy to put your 5s phone inside (the case is 3 pieces). Just snap it together atfer you put your phone inside.

title: beautiful cell phone case
text: This is a beautiful cell phone case. It's sturdy and the finish is very nice. I gave 4 stars because the opening to turn my ringer on/off is a bit deep and you would have to dig in with your fingernail to get to it. Also the ring holder that is attached is plastic-hopefully it will hold up. We'll see.

title: Nice iPhone SE case!
text: Very nice cell phone case! The denim material is a canvas material with nice & neat stitching. There are two credit card slots on the inside and it comes with a mirror that is removable and you get a pen. Not bad for $10! Also, You can hear your texts and calls with no problem when the case is closed!

title: Great phone stand!
text: Great phone stand. Very sturdy with slip resistance on the bottom and where the phone sits on. Very pretty color too! Love it!

title: MAKE SURE THIS IS RIGHT MODEL
text: I love this wallet/phone case.  BUT it doesn't fit my phone and there is nothing similar to it for my model at this time.  Maybe sometime soon.  Good value for the money in my opinion.

title: Works Great!
text: Fits very well, although the gel part does seem like it could stretch out over time, especially if you take it off and on like I do.

title: works ok
text: It works ok on my dash, but might work better on a less textured dashboard than my Toyota.  Also, clean you well before you intll it make sure it get a good grip.

title: Happy
text: Perfect fit, I'm loving this case. It's easy to hold, not slippery, allow quick access for every spot, and still looks brand new. It's not as bulky as the case I had on my previous phone and I'm even happier because of its smoother slip into a pants pocket. No problems with a charging cable fit or camera lens interference. I'd buy it again but doubt that I'll need to for this particular phone.

title: LG G4 case is a perfect fit and it's attractive
text: I recently had my LG G4 repaired and decided to purchase a new case for the phone with its new innards.  This is superior to my previous case in fit, durability and attractive color combination,  Included is a screen protective sheet and concise instructions for putting the case onto the phone.  In order to get a proper fit and save the case, be sure to remove the hard plastic shell from the flexible case.  Move the little flaps at the bottom a few times to get them used to being moved and then slip it onto your phone.  Now snap the harder shell onto the phone, clicking it into the fitted spots and be sure the flaps are accessible.  I've had no problems opening and closing them to insert my charging cable or earphone miniplug and they are securely protected when I snap the flaps into the case.  A nice feature is the protection this affords to the slots which naturally have a tendency to develop a dust or dirt accumulation.  The colors of the actual case are more minty green than the yellow green of the image I see online.  The light teal is a pretty complement.  Since the LG G4 is a thinner style phone, this case does detract from its design but protecting the phone is more important to me and even with the case, its thinner than most others.  All openings are well beveled and the phone operates perfectly.  It's quite a bargain, too, since the phone is now an older and less desirable model.

title: Phone slips in and stays put
text: This Incipio case seems to be more economical than others similar in style so I can assume that it's because of the older phone version. If the current models fit as well as this in their appropriately sized cases, I can recommend the style as a less bulky yet protective two part case which has a smoother surface than I am used to in more protective styles. I do like the gray color which does not show dirt as much as lighter cases.

title: Pretty case, smooth texture
text: This is quite the pretty case, almost as pretty as the rose colored version. The fit is good and after getting accustomed to the buttons, I like it even more. The case is smooth and not at all heavy.

title: More than attractive case
text: A perfect fit, this was much easier to put on the phone than the heavier one it has replaced. The total weight is reduced, as is the size in the hand, pocket or bag. I first thought this would be a fashionable case as opposed to a protective case, but it does protect the phone. A separately purchased glass screen protector finishes the protection. It's not quite a blind case but it adds pizazz.

title: He wanted a second one after damaging the first
text: After much use,  the exterior part of the car broke so until ordering this replacement,  the phone was carried upside down.  Rather than purchasing a different car,  he wanted exactly the same OtterBox case in blue.  These have protected the phone,  clip to a belt and the fact that he did not want me to order a different one says it all. The first one broke with a major fall but the phone was unharmed.

title: Looks good, each tool function works well
text: For those who need a variety of tips on their stylus, I doubt that you can do better than the pair included in the very presentable box by The Friendly Swede.  The 3-in-1 pen is a nice long tool which offers a fiber rounded tip, disk tip and a pen tip.  Not only do you receive two pens, but extra tips so the pens can last a long time.  All parts fit well together, work as they should, look good, and if you are not careful, someone may walk away with yours.  Since this package has two, keep your spare hidden to avoid disappointment.  Because it is important to keep your stylus and screen clean and free of debris, The Friendly Swede has added a small microfiber cloth to assist you.  These pens are a very suitable gifting item, much better in my opinion than some gifts I've seen for graduates and those who have secured a new job.  If you receive a thank you note written in black ink, it's possible that it was written with this pen.  Sample was provided for evaluation.

title: The best tool for following moisturized hands
text: One of the Friendly Swede Fine Point Stylus tools is fantastic and two are even better.  These are finely packaged and protected, ready for presentation should you decide to gift a box, and once you try using one, you will likely be hooked.  I find that it is best to have mine ready before I moisturize my hands or I just can't use my smartphone.  With a pair of replacement discs stored in the tool, it will take me forever to wear these out.  Included is a small microfiber cloth for wiping it down because even a tiny piece of dirt can ruin a screen.  Of course, it is important to use screen protectors, but it is also beneficial to assure that the screen and any tools used are clean and free of debris.  A sample was provided for my evaluation.

title: Position the device in the holder and it should stay in place
text: We had been using another car mount that just would not stick to the dashboard of the car.  The EC mount has a very sticky base which right now does adhere, but since the instructions state to keep this out of the heat, I expect that it may not stay put for long.  I don't know of a car that is driven outside in daylight hours that does not get hot.  Anyway, this particular mount is nice in that there are two buttons which cause the length and width to expand for placement or removal of the device it will hold.  This is a nice feature, but I question the durability since it is made of lightweight plastic.  The head tilts fine and I appreciated not having to assemble any parts, just take it out of the box, remove the protective sheet from the base, and stick it on the car using the stickiness and the suction.  I received a sample for my honest evaluation.

title: LG giving others a run for their money
text:
Currently, I am using a Samsung Galaxy S5 and an HTC One M8, having found over the past year that each has its special attributes. Switching between the two during any given day gives me flexibility and has well prepared me for the LG G4 which has similarity in function of both models. My last LG phone was about four phones ago and I think this one was worth waiting for.

This has a camera with superb options, the ergonomic body design has a mildly contoured back, its removable battery provides enough power to get me through a day without a recharge, it has audio that is better than my Samsung S5 but not as great as my HTC One, the memory can be expanded with an additional microSD card, and its large screen is superb for presbyopic users, especially when the Home buttons are hidden. The HTC One has prepared me with the double tap option to turn on the screen, but nothing has prepared me for the power and volume button on the rear, creating very smooth and uninterrupted side edges which give a very sleek look to the device.

I personally am not dedicated to any one phone manufacturer and upgrade mine every couple of years, generally retaining the last one for use without cell phone service, simply using it for wifi and camera capabilities. I donate the previous phones to the police department. The LG G4 is a model that has impressed me very much and I will be purchasing another one as soon as my plan allows replacement of a second line. I select this over the Samsung S6 for a few reasons which are important to me.

* Battery replacement
* Sleek design with larger viewable screen
* Camera that surpasses all others for using manual and RAW options
* Audio that is better even though it is also on the rear of the device
* Double tap/swipe on/off
* Fits comfortably in a pocket
* Very clear audio for phone services, the main purpose I use a smartphone

Technical specifications are very clear on this site as well as the LG website, so I will not restate what you likely already know if you are at the point of reading these non-professional subjective reviews. This phone is regarded as one of the top introductions in 2015 by most. I expect to see this phone, probably in the leather backed version, very often in television and films, surpassing the Samsung phones I currently notice most frequently.

title: All's good so far
text:
I must admit that I've used a tempered glass screen protector on all phones in my household with great success. Of course, with any change in phones, a need for a new screen protector arises, so it seems that I'm often purchasing or receiving additions. The [[ASIN:B00IUQ41GA Aduro SHATTERGUARDZ Premium Tempered Glass High Clarity Screen Protector]] appears to be as good as most. It's not the absolutely best, but for the price, I think it's a good deal. Whereas some protectors are packaged in cardboard sleeves and such items, this one is encased in a hard plastic shell which completely protects it prior to application to the phone. The application was as simple as any, the key being to being in a clean environment, having a clean screen and hands. The phone is as responsive with the protector as it was without, so that's great.

I was provided the product for review.

title: Sorry, Charlie, but I value my smartphone
text:
Wish I could love the [[ASIN:B00KPXTM0G Aduro Sport Waterproof Case/Bag for Smartphones with Audio Out "Lifetime Warranty"]] but I don't even like it. It's simply to "iffy" for my liking, so it's being used tor holding things that are typically held in a wallet for kayaking and sailing trips. This particular case is nicer than the other I've received from a different company, however it has still not demonstrated the waterproof capabilities that I require to protect my expensive electronic devices. I cannot recommend it for protection in my kitchen sink, so I definitely cannot recommend it for deeper options.

I was provided the product for review.

title: Streaming music through the vehicle's speakers works well as long as the frequency doesn't change
text:
After taking my [[ASIN:B00NW5AVCC Cootree® Wireless Bluetooth FM Transmitter, Multifunction Car Kit]] out for a ride today with a friend, he begged me to let him have it. I told him that he could afford to purchase one for himself because it's very reasonably priced. It took a minute to find a radio frequency, but once I found one and had it entered by using the up and down buttons on the transmitter, we were listening to Prince through his speakers. I used Amazon Music as well as Pandora, both were equally as perfect through the speakers in the truck. Because this has a built in USB port, it's possible to charge my device as it's being used, so I'm not worried about losing power if I'm using my smartphone as a source. It's nice to be able to use the phone also since the music playback pauses. The car charger is very solidly built, too, and its fit was very snug. This is packaged well, too, so it's a good product for gift giving.

Something to think about -- since this device requires a radio frequency, be prepared to change the station in your vehicle as well as the transmitter if you're traveling with this. It helps if you have a companion.

I received this product for a review and did not purchase it myself.

title: Fits well in a handbag and is easy to spot, great for viewing mode
text:
If you are looking for a case for your Samsung Galaxy S5 that is a bit different, the [[ASIN:B00KGNX512 Galaxy S5 Case, GMYLE Book Case Vintage for Samsung Galaxy S5 - Black Classic [Crazy Horse Pattern] [PU Leather] Book style Wallet Flip Slim Case Cover]] fits the bill. It does not cost a fortune and comes with a one year warranty. Just register online using the serial number printed on the card that is enclosed in the folio pocket. It's made of PU leather, a synthetic material that weighs less than real leather and no animals were harmed in its production. My smartphone fit perfectly, snapped right into the case. There is no closure on the case, but since it is not a case that I'll use every day, I'm not worried about that. It does close without any gaps. I would not compare this with a shell type cover, but certainly do like this little book that houses my most valuable tool today. I don't even mind the GMYLE impression on the front cover because it's not embossed in gold like the cute fleur de lis on the cover spine that gives it an additional little pizzazz. This works perfectly for flipping the cover back and hoisting the phone into landscape viewing mode.

I was sent this product in exchange for an honest review.

title: Comes with a good app which aids in achieving good health
text: My newest smartphone is the [[ASIN:B00KNECN9O Samsung Galaxy S5, Copper Gold 16GB (Verizon Wireless)]].  We have Samsung Galaxy S5 phones and an HTC One M8 and find that although the HTC is much more attractive, the Samsung is the phone we are using on Verizon Wireless, our carrier. The Samsung case is plastic, its biggest flaw in my opinion, whereas the HTC is more sturdy. The copper gold color is very attractive,but I always use a protective case and a screen sheet protector. one has a much better camera, a keyboard which contains numerals, and removable battery. The HTC has better audio and a more initially intuitive system navigation. The audio on the Samsung is not great and I often do not hear notifications when the phone is placed face upright. With the rear speaker, it's better having the rear facing upright for a clearer sound. As with any Android phone now, it arrives with applications that are unwanted, so I've been able to clear off some but not all. If you are interested in monitoring your steps, exercise and food intake, a very nice app is built in. My only problem with this one is the reminders after I've not used it for a few days. I do like the ability to check the pulse. You have several options for locking your phone, with an interesting fingerprint option. Battery life on this phone isn't terrible and it isn't great either, so I am using the power saver function.  I like to know there is an extreme setting should I become in need of truly extending the battery life. Samsung's power ports are their own style, imagine a USB with a conjoined smaller twin. It's the same type as my daughter's Samsung Galaxy tablet. The enclosed ear buds are pretty good, too.  All in all, I really like the phone and think it's the best I can get right now for camera capabilities. For audio, the HTC wins.

title: Plastic case is weak link, camera quality is tops
text: In the past several weeks, we've used the Samsung Galaxy S5 in Black and Electric Blue as well as the HTC One M8.  The HTC audio wins hands down as does its basic appearance, but the Samsung phones are also great.  This black phone is more of a dark gray than true black and the entire case is plastic, giving it a cheaper appearance.  I love the Electric Blue color, but since all phones are protected by case covers, the rears are not visible anyway.  Unlike the HTC, this one offers a removable battery, which along with its superior camera, are why we purchased a pair of these on Verizon Wireless.  The phone arrives loaded with apps which are unnecessary and not wanted, so what we could easily remove, we did.  The Health app is used daily by my daughter, I'm not as diligent myself.  A weakness of this phone, particularly as compared to the HTC, is the rear speaker which muffles the audio while the phone is resting.  I've found that by keeping it face down, it's easier to hear.  The fingerprint security option hasn't worked well for either of us, so it's not currently being used.  Samsung uses its own power port, think of a conjoined USB with a smaller twin port, the same as the Samsung tablet.  In general, this is a really good phone which I expect will last the two years of our contract.

title: Camera and Health app are strongest pros
text: We have had a couple Samsung Galaxy S5 phones for nearly a month now, and mine has grown on me.  I'm using the Electric Blue on Verizon Wireless and despite the blue being pretty, it is covered by the case in which I have it protected.  I recently received an HTC One M8 and find that one to be much more attractive.  The Samsung case is plastic, its biggest flaw in my opinion.  Assets over the HTC are the much better camera, keyboard which contains numerals, and removable battery.  The HTC has better audio and a more intuitive system navigation for me.  The audio on the Samsung is not great and I often do not hear notifications when the phone is placed face upright.  With the rear speaker, it's better having the rear facing upright for a clearer sound.  As with any Android phone now, it arrives with applications that are unwanted, so I've been able to clear off some but not all.  If you are interested in monitoring your steps, exercise and food intake, a very nice app is built in.  My only problem with this one is the reminders after I've not used it for a few days.  I do like the ability to check the pulse.  You have several options for locking your phone, with an interesting fingerprint option.  I've not had great luck with this, even saving two different fingerprints, so I'm not currently using it.  Battery life on this phone isn't terrible and it isn't great either.  I amusing the power saver function and like to know there is an extreme setting should I become in need of truly extending the battery life.  Samsung's power ports are their own, imagine a USB with a conjoined smaller twin.  I hesitate to recommend using a standard USB cable but really think it would also charge the phone.  It's the same port as my daughter's Samsung Galaxy tablet.  All in all, I really like the phone and think it's the best I can get right now for camera capabilities.  For audio, the HTC wins.

title: Positioned to be a best seller
text:
The HTC One M8 Harman/Kardon Edition has a deal with Sprint, so if you on a Sprint network, this is for you. I personally am not thrilled with Sprint in my area, so this has been an opportunity for me to spend a month using this one minus the actual phone service. I will be purchasing two of the HTC One M8s for the Verizon network tomorrow and that says a lot.

This device is larger and heavier than our Motorola smartphones, but I've quickly become accustomed to the change. It's advantageous when used as a GPS, a task that's done daily by my daughter and occasionally by myself. The phone is attractive, substantial in construction, and appears to be structurally sound. The screen is clear, not overly sensitive, and the settings are very easy to adjust. Navigation of the system is very, very intuitive if you are familiar with Android systems, and I was able to bring over everything from my Motorola in a matter of seconds. This phone is notorious for extraordinary audio capabilities and I have to agree. For me, the battery has been exceptional, but remember that I've not had it on a telephone network yet. I'll update after getting our new phones on the Verizon network. The camera exceeds any other phone camera I've used with the exception of my friend's iPhone. She's a well known iphoneographer, so I've seen her do things with her phone that make me want to cry. The weakness of this phone is the same as I find with any cellular phone -- it's preloaded with stuff I have no desire to have in my life. Aside from that, this is an outstanding offering which I very, very highly recommend.

title: Sturdy case is a high quality, but the fit is not great (UPDATED REVIEW)
text:
The Otterbox Commuter Series for HTC One M8 adds weight with substantial protection for my new HTC One. The little manual describes how to use the case and a separate little sleeve diagrams how to apply the protective clear sheet for the phone screen. This screen protector is the weakest link for me because nothing I did prevented tiny bubbles from popping up as time passed. I'ĺl likely remove this soon, but do really like the two part case. A hard shell snaps onto a rubber encasement with holes included for the camera, usb, audio, and power button. There is a rubber covering for the volume side button, but the bottom usb and audio port has a moveable thicker plug which can be wiggled into the opening, thereby protecting the slots. Should you want a lighter weight cover, you can bypass using the hard shell and simply use the rubber sleeve which will do a good job of protecting your investment and still feel good in the hand. I like this feel better than my other phone's more gel like case, and its clear that this one will last longer because of its better quality. If you need protection from drops or moisture or you simply want to thicken up your HTC One, I'd definitely consider this one.

EDITED 10/13/2014: The case is holding up well with one exception. The charging port area has cracked because of the snug area for inserting the cable. This phone is not a primary one in this household and it's only charged once a week because it is usually powered off. I have not purchased this style for our other smartphones because of this weakness.

title: 7 month old is enjoying himself
text: Without a device that fits inside the [[ASIN:B00BLI3MUK Fisher-Price 3-in-1 Apptivity Entertainer]], this can be used as a toy with soft edges.  With an iPhone, this seven month old is having a fun time.  He does slobber on the soft padded edge, so its main weakness is that it can't really be washed, but this does protect the iPhone from his sticky little fingers and sure entertains him.  There was no problem downloading the two free apps.  I don't know that I'd really recommend this product, but because it's being used and enjoyed, I've given it four stars.  Having the capability of attaching it to his high chair or stroller helps preventing the dropping game.

title: Pretty color, an average lightweight case
text: I usually really like Belkin products, but the [[ASIN:B0094CX4NK Belkin View Case / Cover For New Apple iPhone 5 (Purple)]] isn't an incredibly great buy when you consider the price and what it offers.  It's lightweight, easy to apply, and allows the great iPhone 5 to be visible.  Using an iPhone for iPhonography, the Griffin case is much better because the rubber sides are softer, feeling more comfortable in the hands when it's used as a camera.  The color violet is lovely, but be aware that it's only around the edge of the phone.  If you're looking to change the color of your iPhone, look at another case.  Having to push the buttons a little harder isn't an issue, and once the case is attached to the camera, it's not difficult to remove to put your iPhone into another case.  This one will be used irregularly and is not a top choice, but it's a fine backup.

title: Hooked on the Cimo S-Line for design, quality & price
text:
I ordered two of the Cimo Soft Shell TPU cases and they arrived in the same Amazon package. The [[ASIN:B0069YUFSI Cimo S-Line Soft Shell TPU Case for Motorola DROID RAZR - Purple]] was in retail packaging and in perfect condition. The [[ASIN:B0069YUO70 Cimo Soft Shell TPU Case for Motorola DROID RAZR Verizon - Red]] was it's partner and they are equally as nice.

After inserting the phone with ease, it was evident that the fit is absolutely perfect and the openings are smooth and uniform. This shell adds a secure feel to the case, making it more comfortable in the hand than the naked phone. We were concerned that the on/off button and volume button would not respond to the touch, but we were pleasantly surprised to see that both work seamlessly. Openings are finely cut and there's no problem using the appropriate inputs. The texture on both sides makes for a secure grip. Adding to the sleek style of the case is the lovely bi-textured S design on the rear. I'd buy these again and likely will within the next two years of this Verizon contract. These Cimos are winning soft cases!

title: Good fit, comfort, style and cost
text:
I ordered two of the Cimo Soft Shgell TPU cases and they arrived in the same Amazon package. The purple case was in retail packaging and in perfect condition. The [[ASIN:B0069YUO70 Cimo Soft Shell TPU Case for Motorola DROID RAZR Verizon - Red]] was not in the retail packaging, but in a plastic sleeve with a hole ripped out of it larger than an inch square. The case itself appeared to be in fine condition, but I wondered if it was indeed a new item. Regardless, I believe these cases are absolutely worth a five star review.

First impression was that the case was not red, but a bright neon pink. After inserting the phone with ease, it does look more red than without the black phone darkening the shade of the light TPU material. The fit is absolutely perfect and the openings are smooth and uniform. This shell adds a secure feel to the case, making it more comfortable in the hand than the naked phone. I was concerned that the on/off button and volume button would not respond to my touch, but I was pleasantly surprised to see that both work seamlessly. Openings are finely cut and there's no problem using the appropriate inputs. The texture on both sides makes for a secure grip. Adding to the sleek style of the case is the lovely bi-textured S design on the rear. I'm getting used to the color now after explaining why I gifted the purple one and not the requested red to the recipient. I didn't feel right about giving what appeared to be a used gift. If you're interested in a purple case, I highly recommend the [[ASIN:B0069YUFSI Cimo S-Line Soft Shell TPU Case for Motorola DROID RAZR - Purple]]. It's exactly the same case, but in a lovely purple color. All in all, I'd buy these again and likely will within the next two years of this Verizon contract. These Cimos are winning soft cases!

title: Easy to set up, awkward for me to use
text:
Once I determined that I could not download the updated software for the [[ASIN:B005U5L5OK Parrot Minikit+ Bluetooth Speakerphone - Retail Packaging - Black]], I phoned Parrot tech support. A very humorous CSR assisted me in rebooting the speakerphone and told me that on a Mac, Safari will not be recognized. I used Firefox, downloaded the software, dragged it over to the speakerphone, and the phonebook from my smartphone immediately was imported to the speakerphone. I'd already charged the battery fully, so I was ready to take it down to the car for a test drive. Attaching to my visor was simple with the clip or additional elastic strap. Plugging into my power was simple with the included adapter. I was good to go.

I personally am quite adept at understanding various accents and dialects, but I really don't care for the accent on this speakerphone. I much prefer an "American" accent, regardless of the dialect, since I'm in the USA. The speakerphone turns itself on when movement is felt and turns itself off after a stationary period. This is a nice feature because I don't remember to turn it off. When a call comes in, I have to focus to understand the name of the caller and speak very clearly to accept or reject the call. I can hear the caller pretty clearly and they report that I, too, am understandable, so that's good. I'm not interested in using this for music because the speakers in my car are superior to the speaker in this product. I, too, am not interested in using the email functions through this, so I will not review that option. As a basic speakerphone, this is no better than my Jabra and definitely not as good as the speakerphone in my TomTom GPS. I'll update this review if I discover more strengths and weaknesses over time. I can't attest to the longevity because I've only had it for a couple weeks. For now, I'd give this an average three star review because of the cost.

title: Light and airy full of comfort
text: A good friend gave me this chair and my first thought was, "What the ??"  She assured me that this is a very comfortable chair and she knew it would meet my needs for comfort and airiness.  Well, she was absolutely right!  The Flat Bungee Office Chair w/ Arms Black is lightweight, made it up the stairs atop my head with no problem.  It's airy and won't gather too much dust.  The five rollers are quality and I don't worry about harming my hardwood floors.  The arms are not adjustable, nor is the rear, but the seat is easily adjusted in height by depressing the handle to the right of the seat.  Guess the manufacturer assumes most customers are right handed.  Because each bungee pair is screwed into the chair by a phillips head screw, I imagine that they would be easy to replace if they ever wear out or have a problem.  I find that by leaning back into the chair, I'm able to work at the computer for hours without a problem and look forward to a long term relationship with the chair.

title: Better than average but not by much
text: Basic silicone case in black snaps onto the Apple iPhone 4 without needing much of a stretch.  It's one solid piece, soft and rubbery, adding a little cushion to the case without standing out from the crowd.  The screen protectors are actually a single screen protector which must carefully be applied to the iPod screen because it's a single application that does not lend itself to adjustment.  A plastic squeegee is included for its application and I have many ideas to recycle the adorable Amazon logo imprinted hard card.  If you're talented, you can carve your own little guitar pick.  Set it in a gold bezel and have a one of a kind pendant.  The tiny cloth screen cleaner can be used on your reading glasses so it's not wasted by a single screen cleaning, but whatever you do, be sure to really clean the iPhone screen with this cloth prior to applying the screen protector!  AmazonBasics boasts minimal packaging, so I wonder why a warranty booklet was necessary with this product.  The directions for applying the screen protector were on a small, easy to follow single folded sheet that doesn't take up much space in the recycling bin.  The booklet and box, on the other hand, seemed to be not so necessary.  All in all, this AmazonBasics Silicone Case isn't elegant or even cute, but it should last at least as long as the phone contract and it's reasonably priced.  If you're looking for a soft case, it's fine.

title: It's an awesome case and has a bit of a “space” look ...
text: It's an awesome case and has a bit of a “space” look and design. Perhaps a little slick- but fits nicely in your hand and pockets. I do wish there was a bit more edge around the screen to keep it from hitting flush on the ground.

title: but it certainly is like a capsule of protection for your iPhone
text: I've tried other brands, and you really can't beat the Defender Series of Otterbox. It may have some bulk to it, but it certainly is like a capsule of protection for your iPhone.

title: Perfect fit & my husband loves it
text: It is very well made and he really likes the textured areas on the side, where you typically hold the phone.

title: great lightning cable
text: works great, well made, very pleased, ordered 2 more.

title: disappointing purchase
text: ripped after a few months, when the phone fell, the screen shuttered, which didn't happen when i used speck iphone cover. I don't recommend it

title: Doesn't fit.
text:
Very pretty, just like in the pictures - - Doesn't fit the advertised phone though. My phone is the same specs and everything is VERY close, but the buttons don't totally line up which makes them hard to press and the case looks a bit tight.

Had to stick with the one the manufacturer gave me instead.

title: Fast, easy to navigate, plenty of space.
text:
Fast, plenty of space for my larger apps, and extra protective of my privileges. I appreciate that the phones asks before giving downloaded apps any special permissions like access to my calls. Easy to navigate, has three on screen buttons for back, home, and alt tab. I bought a thin plastic cover for the phone and it hasn't experienced any scratches or cracks with multiple (pretty rough) drops. So far, loving it!

Only drawback I can see is the camera quality, which is still good but not GREAT.

title: Sturdy, firm.
text:
I've used this in two of my cars. It's a firm hold on both vertical and horizontal vents in the car and has a rotating head that is 'hard' enough to adjust that it doesn't droop with the weight of my phone.

I have a Samsung galaxy note 3, which fits perfectly in the adjustable clamp - though with a gigantic otterbox protector, it does get a bit tight

title: Cheap junk. Color is only painted on.
text: After only having this phone case for a couple of weeks, I began noticing a rough spot on the edge. Didn't think much of it at first but then today, that rough spot ended up being the paint peeling off. Apparently the color of the case is painted on and not actually the color of the rubber. Very disappointed.  The only reason I didn't give it only 1 star is because it actually fits and looks nice on my phone. But quality is poor.

title: Great charger.
text: I have a samsung s7 edge and was having issues with my phone not charging well when I plugged it into my regular chargers so I wondered if maybe the problem was with the charging port. I ordered this in hopes that it would alleviate the problem since my phone no longer needs to be plugged in. I am extremely pleased with this product because it did in fact solve my issue and it works great. Charges very quickly and is convenient to have on my bedside table because I can see the time on my phone without having to pick it up.  I also like the light along the bottom because it let's you know if your phone is in fact charging. Its blue when the phone isnt on it and turns green when charging. This is convenient because sometimes if I place my phone on it quickly it may not be centered properly and I know to adjust the position until the light turns green. I am very happy with this product and will be ordering another one for my husband since he's jealous of mine. Lol

title: Great product
text: I bought 3 of these for my family to take on our recent trip to Hawaii. They work great. The fact that the phone can still be used inside the pouch was a great feature. Its also large enough that we didnt have to remove our phone case to fit. I'll be honest and admit I was afraid to actually take them snorkeling in deep water but they definitely worked for just playing and splashing at the beach. I know many people have had success in using it for snorkling but i know my luck and wasnt willing to risk that i happened to get a faulty case. The clip that attaches the strap is a little wimpy. I wouldn't trust holding the phone by the strap only, especially in rough water. But overall this is a great product for a great price and I would definitely recommend it to others.

title: Good case if you are not hard on your phone
text:
I ordered for my iPhone 6s (and had to replace it once when the phone fell and the corner of the case broke), and now I have ordered it for my new iPhone 8.

It's primary appeal for me is the picture of a Shakespeare—and that the text is Hamlet. My students will tell you I have a bit of a problem when it comes to these two. 😄

This is not the sturdiest of cases. There is no protection for the screen. If you drop the phone a few times, the case may not or may not survive. It for someone who is not hard on a phone and keeps it in my purse or on my desk or nightstand at all time (never in a pocket where it might fall out), this case is sufficient. (And I have a separate tempered glass screen protector.)

title: Replacement for an older one
text:
My boyfriend had an all-black version of this for his phone, and the slider compartment no longer latched. This size/design has apparently been discontinued (as it is for an older model iPhone), so I was glad to find a listing for it here.
The two-tone design makes this one more noticeable, and he gets one or two comments/compliments on it each week. He is thrilled to have the security of the latching wallet compartment on the back again (he doesn't like to carry a wallet). (It's snug enough I had trouble getting it open, so no danger of his license and debit card falling out like they did on the last one.)

title: Good protection for your phone

title: Error in the quotation
text: I cannot speak to the quality of the physical item -- but the graphic has a big problem.  That quote is not from any of Shakespeare's works.  It is a line from Verdi's opera "Falstaff."  So the confusion is easy to trace, but unfortunately, someone who truly appreciates Shakespeare would not care for this item.

title: Don't walk, run...away from this model.
text:
UPDATE (May 2016): When I finally switched to an iPhone last month -- after the THIRD Motorola DROID RAZR M died in a two-year period (basically every 7 1/2 - 8 months, like clockwork), the Verizon tech who was helping me said this model comes back ALL. THE. TIME. Buyer beware.....(End update)

I have loved my Motorola Droid phones -- they are the only smartphone I have ever had, even though others have tried to lure me over to the iPhone, but this is ridiculous. I got my first Razr M in April of 2014, as an update when it was time to renew my contract. I liked that it was thinner than the phone I was replacing (a Droid 4), and it seemed to be a great phone overall. Fast forward to January 2015 -- right at eight months -- and it would not even turn off, but neither would it turn ON. I had been having to reboot it multiple times per day, as it kept freezing. One night during a reboot, it got stuck on the start-up screen with the red glowing symbol...and it stayed there until the battery died. If I recharged it, the same thing would happen. So since it was (thankfully) still under warranty, Verizon replaced it. That was January 2015. By early July 2015, I was once again rebooting my phone multiple times a day. Text messages were not always being delivered, the phone did not vibrate for incoming calls when it was on vibrate (so I missed a lot of important calls), and it was generally undependable. I took it in to Verizon and they examined it, telling me to remove a few particular apps and do a factory reset. Ibdid, and within a week, I was back because that had not fixed anything. So in late July 2015, the phone was replaced AGAIN. It is now the end of November -- just four months later -- and this third Razr M is driving me bananas. It reboots itself randomly (sometimes several times a day), I have people telling me they get the same text from me more than once , I find others have sent me texts I never receive, it once again does not vibrate on incoming calls when I have set it to vibrate....I am just DONE. I can understand a phone here and there having problems, but three models of the same phone in less than two years that cannot make it more than eight months before dying? That tells me there is something wrong with the overall design.

title: Great Lens - Gets the Job Done; Installation a Bit Tricky
text:
Works great.

Pros:
*I've had this on my phone for several months to replace my cracked lens, and it's been great
*No issues with blurriness
*Still scratch- and crack-free (I'm pretty rough on my phone)
*Once I figured out what I was doing (see "cons" below), it was a satisfying project (like putting together a puzzle)

Cons:
*As they specify in the description, no installation instructions are included, which can be nerve-wracking for phone repair
*Like the description suggests, I looked up some YouTube videos to figure out installation, and there wasn't a whole bunch of help to be found; after a few attempts watching videos in English, I ended up watching two videos in different languages that were the most helpful
*The circles on the lens are different sizes and I couldn't tell which one was meant to go at the top; I ended up guessing and it's been fine, so far.

(2) Even though it protects my phone really well, the case itself seems to scratch pretty easily and the colors have worn off a bit around the edges. I already have several scratches and worn areas. title: Sturdy Car Phone Mount! ...and it looks far more stylish than the plastic ones!
text:
This is a fabulous car phone mount! The sticky pad on the bottom works really well in my car and the mount feels very sturdy.The mount stays where you position it, and the phone doesn't seem to weight it down or cause the mount to droop.

There is a thin metal plate that comes with it, which is designed to stick to the outside of your phone case, but the magnet is strong enough that I was able to put it inside the phone case (between the phone and the case), and it still works wonderfully - keep in mind this trick may not work if you have a really thick phone case.

I like it so much that I bought a second one for my husband's car.

Bonus: the gold one is really cute!

title: Installed on iPhone 8+ Without a bubble!
text:
Installed easy in a few minutes, and it looks like I paid big bucks to have one professionally installed.

The cutouts for the speaker, camera, and home buttons are spot on!

Comes with tape "hinges". Lack of these are probably the main cause of botched screen protector installations.

Comes with a dust remover sticky.

Kind of odd that it did not come with cleaning wet wipes. This turned out to be a blessing in disguise. I found that regular dumb alcohol wipes, and green label Bounty Paper Towels work better that any wet wipes included with screen protectors that I have ever used!

Here is what I did:

Washed my hands to remove oils

Laid one Bounty on the desk to set the phone on.

Cleaned the crap off the screen of my with the alcohol wipe.

Used another Bounty to wipe of the alcohol.

Lined up the screen protector perfectly and applied the hinges to the protector, and the phone.

Used the included dust protector sticky to remove the lint.

Peeled the back off the screen protector, laid it down onto the phone, and it literally adhered itself in a couple seconds. It was cool to watch!

No I don't work for Bounty. They simply make the best paper towel ever, which I think is common knowledge. I get cheap paper towels for regular use, but when I need to do something serious like this, I always break out the Bounty...

title: Converted a micro-sim to a nano
text:
Worked fine, but I did need to file the edges afterwards to fit my newly created nano-sim into my iPhone 6s without forcing it.

Basically I took a micro-sim out of a Cricket phone, chopped down to size with this tool, filed it down a little with the included file, installed it in a Verizon iPhone 6s, turned the phone on and it just worked.

title: You get what you pay for
text: It's an okay phone but not great by any means. I get quite a few app crashes from apps that never crashed on my former phone, regular restarts help a bit. I have constant issues with MMS messages (which may be the fault of Virgin). Bluetooth is okay, but again it hangs occasionally and sometimes merely turning my head will drop a connection to my Bluetooth headphones (again something that never happened with my former phone and those same headphones). As always, phone comes with a ton of invasive crapware apps. Call quality is okay but variable, but again I don't know if I can blame the phone for this. In all I'll live with it but I'm far from impressed by anything except the price. This said, now I understand the limitations and shortfalls of the phone the price looks at best "reasonable," and certainly not the "good deal" I'd hoped for.

title: Great Phone AWFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM SPRINT
text:
I think the PalmPre is a great phone at a great price but buying through Amazon and trying to set-up with Sprint is a nightmare. I will admit I'm trying to port my old number to this new phone (shouldn't be too difficult, we are legally entitled to port old #s). Two days in and 12 calls to Sprint customer service and -- my port will take a week to complete (may not be Sprint's fault), and the neither of the two temporary phone number they've given me work at all. To add to this my old number has been disabled because of the port so I'm trapped without a phone!

Sprint customer service really are incredibly dysfunctional. The seemingly simple number port has created a circle of confusion like no other. You rarely get a native English speaker, everyone gives you different information and when they can't work out what's wrong instead of staying on the line and trying to escalate your problem they just transfer you to another first line person who wastes your time asking you your account # and PIN #s etc. I literally should have made recording of me explaing my problem.

To add insult to injury I've noticed that as my Pre's battery drops so my Sprint reception gets worse and calls quality gets problematic.

This said, I love the Pre itself. Brilliantly designed on every front. Easy to use, powerful, elegant, and feature rich.

I guess with a Pre and Sprint you're at least not paying the iphone tax for terrible service.

I ended up using my spares on my parent's phones so we can all have one.  The ring is so useful to have, not just to hold your phone by but also as a stand.  I use it daily as a stand. title: Great alternative to jetpacks/hotspots for those of us in rural areas.
text:
I was getting 20 mbps out of a Pantech MH291L hotspot, but wanted a device that was more reliable and that had Cat 6 LTE support - specifically carrier aggregation. I was somewhat skeptical about how well this device would work.

After installing the correct Verizon firmware the Mofi 4500-4GXeLTE-SIM4 has worked perfectly. I've achieved download speeds of 7.5 Mbps (60 mbps) and my ping is regularly 40ms or less. Carrier aggregation functions flawlessly on Verizon using Bands 4 & 13 in my area. In an area where my MH291L showed a Band 4 signal of approx -95 dbm this device shows -76 dbm - a HUGE improvement in signal strength.

I received great customer service when I was having problems with the device dropping the LTE connection constantly.

title: Great Product for the Price
text:
I received my Ravelli tripod quickly and in perfect condition.

I have used the tripod many times, including in the middle of the night, in a foot of snow to take some long-exposure sky photos. It is very light, has metal legs with rubber feet and plastic components. It has so many different adjustment options that I'm able to set up the camera exactly how I want to.

There is a crank lever to allow the threaded center bar to go higher, a large swivel handle that goes up and down and side to side, a hinge type plate to do vertical or angled photos, and of course two levels of leg adjustments. Since there are a lot of adjustment knobs and levers you really have to be aware of what each one does. That way you don't accidentally add too much pressure to an adjuster when it doesn't do what you want it to and breaks. The product is all plastic, so I can see if handled roughly where this could happen. I haven't had any problems though. There are also two bubble gauges to make sure everything is set level.

The bag is handy and durable, but since it takes a bit of time to squeeze the tripod in and out of it, I usually do without it. The tripod has a handle on it which makes it easy to carry anyway.

I also always just leave the quick release plate attached to my DSLR. It makes for a quicker set-up. If I forget to check if the knob on the bottom of the plate is tight, the camera plate does slowly move downwards if I'm taking vertical photos. I use a Nikon D5100 with an 18-55mm lens and the tripod doesn't have any problem holding it that way... if it's tight. There is also a hook in the center of the tripod which can be used to hold weight for added stability, which a lot of the previous reviewers didn't mention. I haven't needed to use it though.

All in all I was happily surprised at the quality and design of the tripod for the price.

title: SUPERB! If you take the time to do it right. Fits my 15.6 Yoga 730 PERFECTLY.
text:
I am a perfectionist. I probably spent 20 minutes cleaning and wiping my screen before I even got out the stickers and tape. Why have a bunch of dust on it to begin with?

PRODUCT PROS & CON
- The front side has plastic handles which make alignment a snap. Also useful if you need to pull up the screen to release a bubble. (Slowly and carefully so you don't break it.)
- Fits my screen perfectly very nearly edge to edge. Maybe 1-2 mm difference on the sides. The camera cutout isn't quite centered over the lens, but it's close enough. I tested, and it does not interfere with the camera at all.
- Perfectly clear and smooth!
- Works great with my Active Pen 2. Maybe even better than without it. IMPRESSED!
- ONE con: For a screen this size, there should be more, larger stickers to remove dust. But scotch tape also works well.

MY PERSONAL TIPS:
- Kimtech delicate task wipers leave no residue and are as close to dustless as paper wipes can be. I use them for my glasses.
- Good old clear scotch tape is great for picking up dust, especially around the edges of the screen.
- I'm running a HEPA air purifier on turbo to reduce dust in the air. Obviously not necessary, but it reduces dust landing on the screen or protector while your work.
- I also check the protector itself for dust after I remove the film in case any static effect draws dust to it.
- Work deliberately but not too slowly because dust from the air may settle if you dally.
- Use the plastic handles on the front to position perfectly. I worked with the screen upside down and the camera toward me and lined up with the camera then slowly lowered the protector flat.
- Run finger from bottom to top of the screen and be patient as seals outward. Leave it alone. Do not help it. If you get any big bubbles, use the handle to pull it back up and the squeegee thing to press them out. Really much easier to lift the screen, but be careful because you don't want to break it.
- I had ZERO dust, so I was done at this point. If you have any dust, you can also lift it up again by the handles and use the dust stickers or scotch tape to remove the dust. But be careful you don't add more dust or fingerprints or break the protector.

SUPERB! VERY PLEASED!

title: Beautiful phone. Too bad it crashes if you install apps. Yes, I'm talking about "Unfortunately My Launcher Has Stopped Working"
text:
Gorgeous phone, nice specs, if only it worked. Seriously, My Launcher crashes--you know the thing that runs the home screen. Kinda basic requirement to have a functional launcher. All manner of apps crash. I mean, I should say, if you don't install any apps, it works fine. If you want to install apps on this phone--and you do, that's why you got a phone with 64GB of storage--then it kinda sucks as a phone capable of running basic apps like news, weather, and clock.

I called Blu. They were open, and it didn't take long for me to get a human being. But they told me to do basic stuff I'd already done--like I've done factory reinstalls and done all the stuff the internet suggests. So they had me email them screenshots with info about my phone, of error messages, and info about the apps that were crashing. After 20 screenshots, I'd had enough screenshotting stuff going wrong.

You know what? THEY SENT ME INSTRUCTIONS ON HOW TO RESET THE BLU LIFE ONE X2. Not the MINI. I mean, sure, I can do another hard reset, but I don't imagine it's going to make a difference coz I've already done plenty of hard resets.

BLU, get it together.

title: Great--if you know what you're doing
text:
A while back I accidentally bought the version of this for the Samsung S3 mistaking it for the kind you apply wet. It took me three tries and all the protectors to finally attach it in an acceptable manner. However, once applied, this thing is strong and crystal clear. Much clearer than the screen protectors you apply wet, which end up looking foggy.

So here's what I learned from the comments that were super helpful.

1) Slow down, son. If you rush this, you will muck it up.
2) Scotch tape is your new best friend.
2.1) If some crap gets stuck to the phone or protector, just pull the protector back and use a round of tape (make a circle with the tape, sticky side out)to remove the offending particle.
2.2) Once you get the protector on perfectly, get ready to take the protector's protector off. Redundant, no? Whatevs. Get ready for bubbles to form when you pull the protector's protector off. Stick additional tape to the other side of the protector's protector to reduce bubbles the bubbles that will form if you only use the provided tab to pull (after you read the directions, this might make more sense).
2.3) Once the protector's protector is off, if any bubbles remain, stick tape to the actual protector, carefully pull back, and reapply without bubbles. Once you're done, Pull the tape off the protector by peeling it back from the phone side and not the loose tape side. Make this easy on yourself and fold the tape on itself before attaching to the protector so that you have a little handle to grab and don't have to scratch the protector trying to get the final tape off.

Once you've done all this, you should have a gorgeous, long-lasting screen protector. Allow yourself at least thirty minutes to do the job, even though it will probably take less time. READ THE OFFICIAL INSTRUCTIONS AND WATCH THE VIDEO ON THE PRODUCT'S WEBSITE BEFORE STARTING.

title: A decent TPU case but not particularly slim.
