It came with a bright yellow floating handle (bonus for me), wrist strap, carabiner, micro cloth, and kickstand I will be using my phone for taking pictures in a boat on a fishing trip . Between the waves splashing, the boat bouncing and the excitement of taking pictures of the catch, I feel confident my phone won't get wet or dropped into the deep blue sea. Haven't used it yet, but it is packed and ready to go! :)

Review update: Case worked perfectly! Nice tight fit all the way around, thumbprint feature worked great and was able to take lots of pictures, mute button worked great and wrist lanyard was a great feature. Pretty beefy and rugged. The price was really decent too.
The only thing I would have a slight negative say, would be the face cover should be anti-reflective as the glare from the sun and water made it difficult to see the object of my pictures. Would definitely recommend

title: Perfect.
text:
I paid a few bucks more to purchase from Chubbiestech based on a review and to avoid any problems. (Reading about the A10 reviews was scaring me until I realized I was reading the wrong product lol.) This is for the Samsung Galaxy S10e. Being from the S- product line, it's Samsung's flagship product and you can read the history and differences between the models on Wikipedia. I found this information very helpful.

I lucked out with the right Seller and got a phone that really seems brand new and works excellent in every way. (A previous purchase of a different model and seller was excellent in every way but then we discovered it wouldn't charge.) I'm so happy I bought this!

Pros

Mine was in new condition without a scratch, and functions perfectly in every way. I was able to load SmartSwitch on my old J7 and only had to manually download a matching icon set (and create a new Samsung account to download it.) Everything else (including my custom wallpaper from an outside source) transferred exactly.

I wanted a smaller profile/screen because I really loved my J7 and can easily operate it with one hard. I find modern phones too large and heavy and I'm not a gamer. The S10e's profile is surprisingly *smaller* than the J- series and fit my desire. Could easily fit inside a shirt pocket.

It runs way faster than my old phone and I verified with DevCheck that it does indeed have 6 Gigs of Ram. That's more than I ever had before and so it seems real speedy and capable to me and also 128 Gigs of space is way more than I ever thought of using.

I mostly only use my phone as a music source and the sound quality thru my headphones is superb, like my J7 which I prefer to the modern soundboards that I have to tweak; I don't have to use the equalizer on this and the bass is great.

The Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, screentouch and call quality (and charging) all work great. The mobile data connection on my old sim for some reason is much faster (30M??) on 4GLTE and the upload speed is 3x my old phone too, I can't imagine why. But the connection with the same service is just stronger and has much better coverage. I didn't realize it was the old phone limiting it. That's like broadband over 4G lol.

I simply slipped in my old Sim and it connected with no problem or troubleshooting.

Anyway the S- series hardware of this phone is superb. Mine came with Android 12 which I understand is the highest available for this model. My J7 was stuck in Android 8. I didn't want to upgrade to a phablet nor pay a lot for features I didn't want to begin with.

Caveats/Tips

I never used a case before but this phone is so small (yay!) AND slippery I needed to buy a case. Don't want to drop it and scratch the screen because my big clumsy fingers can't hold onto it. I don't have a problem navigating the screensize.

Had to manually customize icons after installing everything. This requires a Samsung account. (You can delete it from Accounts afterward if you wish.)

If you use Smart Switch to transfer and duplicate your experience from your old phone you need to unpair the devices listed under Bluetooth and re-pair them for them to work on your new phone.

Many/Most of your programs transferred and websites will require you to log-in again (so you'll need your passwords) but the data (pics/docs/program files) transferred without a hitch. (You can download Smart Switch on your old phone from Google Play.)

My phone has the annoying T-mobile start-up screen (less annoying if you turn the sound off) but it doesn't harm anything functionally.

Samsung apps preinstalled cannot be uninstalled or disabled. However Google apps can be.

The battery is small (3100) but I'm used to that from the J7. I tried a larger capacity battery in my J7 but became impatient with the charging time so actually prefer the quick charging of these.

This review is obviously for folks who may not have done this before or are doubtful about the quality of the renewed product.

I'm totally happy with the new phone and the process of setting it up was seamless. Definitely worth it and you saved a lot of money! (Now you can peruse the internet and modern apps like the Joneses! :)

Update: It's a bit too small to be honest, and very SLIPPERY, however still prefer this to the large ones. Wish they still made J-size. But everything works great, sounds great and I'm getting 50M download on LTE! All I do is listen to music so it's fine for my needs. Great price for a fast phone.

title: 252M download 😄 , 5 up
text:
Put in Qlink sim, up and running at over 200 m speed; did not have to sign into Samsung account, deleted most of the apps I didn't want, love this phone already. 4g ram seems fast since I was on 2; wanted 6+ like another brand but for same money happy I went with 5G instead.

If sound is good, as my previous Samsungs, we're good; I bought this actually as my main stereo (receiver) at home with Mpow 59(+) headphones.

I read the bad reviews. Hotspot, tethering,
Wi-Fi Calling all work fine on Qlink. It's not the phone, your carrier restricts these functions. If anything comes up, I'll update. You can download and use Google keyboard/swype typing instead of Samsung. I've used Samsung and particularly the J7 line for years, if you're happy with those, you'll be happy with this. It's the same, new version with 5G. Just buy it.

---

Samsung forced software update and now my speed is capped at 5Mbs. In effect the purpose of getting a 5G phone is negated. So sick of being cheated by corporate America.

Well now it fixed itself to about 150m or so.

title: Best. Phone. Ever. Really! :)
text: Althought I wanted a white one (I bought a hard-shell case for color), this is simply the best cellphone I have ever had, and I will never want to trade it in when I have to for something... lesser. I'm aging and eye-sight is diminishing, and only this phone (6'3" screensize) is big enough for me to easily read. It's my first modern "smartphone", and although I was intimidated and there's a little learning curve for newcomers to "smartphones", this "phablet" (phone & tablet :) is simply the best and has all the features and functionality I want. I am *so* pleased (and relieved) with it! I had to go with AT&T because they're the only carrier I could get this phone with, but they upgraded it to 4G-LTE and modern software so it was worth it. It updates itself a lot and I have turned off a few programs in application settings. You can also set data limits in the phone itself which helps since AT&T doesn't have an unlimited (4G) data plan. Only video will run it up that high however. I was watching television from China in the park with my dog! 4G-LTE is almost like having Wi-Fi on-hand everywhere you go! Again, set your data limits. It is truly an enjoyable phone with countless features, and I'm happy I held out for this model and large-size screen. Totally worth it. :) Tip:  Make sure it comes from Amazon activated before you open the box (see my review on a different Amazon/Carrier cellphone experience and beware). Note that only a carrier-activated phone of this model will be updated with 4G-LTE (hopefully), the unlocked models on Amazon are 2-G/3-G only!

title: Great shopping purse in the time of COVID-19.
text:
I love this Phone purse. These days with COVID-19 I can shop and have access to my phone and the credit card without having to contaminate my regular purse. I can look at the shopping list on my phone, make and receive phone calls without having to dig out my phone from my purse. I also put in the other pocket the credit card I will use for shopping and a mini bottle of hand sanitizer. After I am done shopping, I wipe down this phone purse with a Clorox wipe, and pull out my phone which has remained clean and uncontaminated.
My phone is a Samsung Galaxy Note 8 with a case, and it fit inside the purse with room to spare. The purse comes with 2 straps, a wrist strap, and an cross body strap. The material is plastic, so can spray disinfectant and not worry about ruining the material.
The one thing that does not work through the clear plastic is the retina scan for the phone, so you will need to enter your password or pattern to unlock your phone while in your purse. Not a big deal for me.

title: Do not buy - The screen protector for iPhoneX is short and you will see color strip at the top/bottom of the screen.
text:
This is an OK protection for your iPhone X.
The case is solid and easy to install. It will probably provide adequate protection. Somewhat bulky.
Installation of the glass protector was relatively easy with the included excellent alignment tool. You may get a large air bubble that you will have to quickly squeeze out.
Here is the bad - When the bottom/top is perfectly aligned - the top "ears" that go around the notch are short by about 1/20 of an inch. You will see a color strip at the top/bottom of the screen when the screen is white. Its annoying...
Don't try to realign the glass protector - even if you are extremely careful - It does not help and it is very likely that it will not stick to the screen.
Returning due to no response from customer support. I hope they make the screen protector larger.
I purchased this protector: [[ASIN:B074GWQMRS iPhone X Screen Protector, [2-Pack] ESR [Force Resistant Up to 22 Pounds] iPhone X Tempered Glass, Case Friendly for iPhone X iPhone 10 5.8-inch 2017 released version]] and this case:[[ASIN:B074CMWM9H Spigen Liquid Air Armor iPhone X Case with Durable Flex and Easy Grip Design for Apple iPhone X (2017) - Matte Black]]

title: Versatile

title: Works really well
text: I've had the windshield ones before & the heat always makes them loose eventually so thought I'd try a vent  one. I wasn't that optimistic it would work on our Honda Civic, & would break the vents but it actually does work great & doesn't move around. Liked it so much so that I got another one for our other car. I can still move the vent side to side, just not up & down. Our Samsung phones are in a case with pop sockets on the back, & it still fits & doesn't move.

title: A good solid phone
text: This is the 2nd one I got for the family.  Bought from Amazon warehouse due to damaged packaging, which you can never really tell to be honest.  The 1st one had an unusual issue, but as always, Amazon customer service is top notch & they got me a replacement from the warehouse asap.  It's also new, just the box was damaged (again, could hardly tell) & it works great!!  Saved so much money off the price doing it this way & we love the J7.

title: A must have for pop sockets
text: Pop sockets do tend to fall off after a while due to being used a lot etc, so these are a godsend to have. Now we can keep our original pop sockets without worry. This is a great idea!

title: Good screen protectors.
text: Got these for a new J7, & the video is really helpful for all the steps to do it right.  I actually got the 1st one on without a single bubble (1st time ever...). Nice to have a couple of backups in case, but so far don't need.  Fits the phone very well. Much better for not showing fingerprints than the ones we had before that were just plastic.

title: Great quality case.
text:
Got this case for a new J7 phone & love it. Really easy to grip & the black looks nice.

**Update 10/2020 - finally had it's ultimate test & passed 100%!! On an elliptical machine, phone fell off the machine, bounced off the moving metal parts, & landed face down on the cement. I expected a cracked screen or something, but not a scratch, & kept working as if never happened!!!

title: Wish all carriers did this kind of trial.
text: Where I sit in my current office has me in a dead zone, where I get no coverage, so this was the perfect way to test a carrier to see if I could get any reception. Set up was easy, & it worked fine most of the time, not 100%, but still so much better than what I had before, so will definitely consider Mint in the future. I wish others would allow this short trial, so can test before switching.

title: They work great
text: Wanted a spare for traveling, keep 1 @ work etc, & this was a really good bargain for 2. Tested both of them & the magnets held & the watch charged fine, just like the original. It's piece of mind to know we have spares.

title: Not a bad phone for the price.
text: I've had 2 other BLU phones, & really love this brand. I admit I don't love this one as much as my Vivo XL, as it's a little bit heavier & doesn't seem as sleek, but it works fine & gets the job done.  The enclosed screen protector is a nice touch, but it shows fingerprints in the worst way, so will eventually replace it. I always like the BLU cases that come with the phone, & never have to buy another kind.

title: So much easier this way.
text: Got this for hubby who said "Finally!"  No more taking out the watch part to charge, he's very happy & using it all the time.  The pop out one will just be for travel now.

title: Good product.
text: Wanted something that would lie flat to travel with, so tried this.  Works so well that hubby stole it & now has it on his desk for his Samsung S6 phone. It opens pretty wide, & I tested it on my Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 & BLU phone (both ways), & it held securely.  Ended up getting another one for myself.

title: Good value.
text: I admit, I don't have the product this is designed for, but some of the phone protectors are so darn expensive, so I buy an affordable pack for something else, & cut them down for whatever I need.  These are nice & thick, no bubble issues, & if I mess 1 up, have 2 more!

title: BLU is a good brand.
text: I already have the BLU Studio 5.0 C HD  which is a great phone & I still use it, but on a whim decided I wanted a newer version that didn't cost a fortune. This is lighter & thinner, with really clear resolution, & I love it.  I like that it comes with a case, which suits my needs just fine. I botched the screen protector that came with it, so used a different one I had for something else & cut it down.  I like BLU phones because of them being unlocked with a dual sim, which is great for traveling. Since it does use a USB Type C charger, I had to order a bunch of new cables/adapters, which is a shame & wished it used regular micro USB, but so be it in the world of fast charging.  I refuse to pay 100's of dollars for a smartphone, & that is why I remain a big fan of BLU phones.

title: OK for a basic phone.
text: Overall its an ok phone for just talk & text, don't use the internet.  The battery life is only 3 days though, which is disappointing but it's ok for what we need at this time.  I like the fact you can add an SD card, but do hate the propriety connector for the charger/earphones which means you have to buy special ones.

title: Works as expected
text: It works fine & we needed a spare in case 1 of ours dies.  I find that both our Pantech phones don't hold battery charge for more than 3 days, even on standby, but having a spare is nice.

title: Love it.
text: Got for hubby's new S6 work phone, so didn't want to spend a fortune, & they work great. Not sure why so expensive in the store. Only used the one, as got it right the 1st time.  No bubbles & a really nice finish. Fits perfectly too.  I'd recommend.

title: Good product
text: Does the job & at the right price, no complaints. Ordered a couple of sets so would have a spare if one gets messed up. Nice to have one of each kind in case I ever get those other size SIMS.

title: Great Phone
text: If I could give this 4 1/2 stars I would, as only reason this didn't get 5 is the phone volume (even speaker) which could louder. This is a starter smartphone for me as don't have one currently. I didn't want to spend a lot for a phone that I may not like, so thought this was really good value, & had good reviews.  The dual SIM was a big selling point for traveling, along with being unlocked.  It uses regular size SIMS, but if you had a mini or micro, could use a SIM adapter.  I got the blue one, & love the color, along with the blue case that came with it.  Screen protector that came with it wasn't good, couldn't get the bubbles out at all, so had an extra thick tablet one, cut it down to fit & that works great.  It is a fingerprint magnet without a protector.  Battery life was fine, charge once a day at most if you use heavily otherwise in standby will last a few days.  I got a 32GB card to extend the memory & moved some of my games to it to save phone storage (yes you can do it on this version of Android).  It seemed bigger than I imagined, even though I had the dimensions, & was torn on whether I wanted a smaller device, but makes sense to be bigger for ease of games etc, & now I'm used to it, I actually love it.  I did a lot of research on phones to see which one would work best for me since I'm a newbie to the smartphone world, & I'm really grateful to the other reviews which helped me choose this. I'm glad I picked it & have no regrets so far.

title: Great Option
text: I didn't order this for the usual traveler reasons, since I live in the USA, but wanted to test out a new smartphone without having to use the SIM card from the current dumbphone (no data plan on it).  You can select if you want a reg or mini SIM, & I ordered a 7 day unlimited talk & text w/ 500mb data for $25.  It arrived very fast in the mail, I just put in the SIM & did the text setup, which was really easy.  I was able to test out the new phone, & now can decide what I want to do next. If you are visiting the USA, or just need a temp plan & phone#, this is a great option.

title: Nice case

The stylus was a nice bonus but a little hard to get into the elastic holder, so I use a thinner one. I didn't use the screen protector as didn't read the description properly to know that was included & had ordered a separate one....dang it.  It's a good price/value for all you get, & may consider another one down the road in a different color.

title: not recommended
text:
In my honest opinion the difficulty of this is enough for someone to get a license doing it and offering to install it for you in a phone store. There is a LOT that can go wrong, i tried 3 times, twice because there are two glass protectors and once more when i went for the warranty. (which costs 10$ for them to ship another one)
first, its obviously not cheap, and theres not much i can think of other than the gimmicky UV light thing that would make it cost so much.
second, its VERY difficult to install without dust if you live somewhere dusty in general, had to learn this the hard way, i guess thats my problem though.
More importantly, the adhesive given is often not enough and doesn't actually spread all the way. After some hours of googling AFTER i screwed up 3 times, i learned that you're supposed to tilt the phone to help the adhesive move along... couldn't find that anywhere except from a random reddit post, so even then i'm not sure.

Either way i'm obviously not a trained professional to install this and i can only hope you manage to become one within the span of your 2 attempts.

title: It is OK for the Price
text: This plastic stand is easy to carry along in your work bag and easy to set up.  It is light weight, which is good for portability, but also means that it is not as sturdy as a wood or metal stand would be.  While it will hold up a pattern leaflet or chart, but I don't think it could manage a bound book.  I also use it in my painting space, to hold up photographs that I use for my painted versions.  It is convenient for propping up recipes in the kitchen now and then.  So, it is handy enough, but I will also  be looking for a larger, metal or wood version for my craft room.

title: Read the bulleted list carefully--does not work with all providers.
text: Beautiful phone.  I did not read the fine print, however.  This does not work with Verizon.  Also, it's an international version, which seemed to mean there were numerous languages to navigate to set the various preferences.  Overall, well-recommended on Youtube, etc.
